title.narrative: OP 3.1: ADVOCACY AND SENSIBILIZATION

description.narrative: The public has knowledge about child rights and knows how to become engaged to protect them., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, society's commitment to respect and promote child rights in Uruguay strengthened

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The public has knowledge about child rights and knows how to become engaged to protect them.

description.narrative: UNICEF focused a large part of its communication efforts on positioning children and adolescents as victims of the pandemic on the public and political agenda, and on giving families tools to protect their rights. UNICEF conducted an integrated humanitarian campaign with communication, advocacy, C4D and fundraising objectives. It was key to show that, despite not being the ones who get sickest from COVID-19, children are the ones who suffer the effects of the response, to give families tools to counteract these effects, and to position UNICEF as the humanitarian aid agency responding to the most vulnerable families and their children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2021
